Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: There was a smaller excess of MB in antiplatelet users vs nonusers with ICH ( OR , 1 . 7 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 3 - 2 . 3 ; P < 0 . 001 ) , but findings were similar for antiplatelet users with IS / TIA ( OR , 1 . 4 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 2 - 1 . 7 ; P < 0 . 001 ; P difference = 0 . 25 ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| ICH (Intracerebral Hemorrhage) |
| IS / TIA (Ischemic Stroke or Transient Ischemic Attack) |

The paragraph mentions two types of strokes: Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH) and Ischemic Stroke or Transient Ischemic Attack (IS / TIA). These are the entities that can be identified as diseases in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Intracerebral Hemorrhage (ICH) |
| Ischemic Stroke or Transient Ischemic Attack (IS / TIA) |

The paragraph mentions two types of strokes, which are the only entities that can be identified as diseases in the paragraph. Other entities such as "MB" (meaning unclear without additional context), "OR", "95% CI", "P", and "antiplatelet users" are not diseases but rather statistical measures or study participants.
